intro: Ampelocissus leptotricha, commonly known as the rock fig, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Moraceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by edible, fig-like fruits that are typically consumed by birds and mammals. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
